title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

reading.title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

passages.content:
Câu 1: The word "it" in paragraph (A) refers to
A. 99 percent
B. species
C. environment
D. extinction
Câu 2: The word "ultimately" in paragraph (A) is closest in meaning to
A. eventually
B. exceptionally
C. dramatically
D. infortunately
Câu 3: What does the author say in paragraph (A) regarding most species in Earth's history?
A. They have caused rapid change in the environment.
B. They have remained basically unchanged from their original forms.
C. They have been able to adapt to ecological changes.
D. They are no longer in existence.
Câu 4: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in paragraph (A) as resulting from rapid ecological change?
A. Availability of food resources
B. Introduction of new species
C. Temperature changes
D. Competition among species
Câu 5: The word "demise" in paragraph (A) is closest in meaning to
A. recovery
B. help
C. change
D. death
Câu 6: Why is "plankton" in paragraph (B) mentioned?
A. To emphasize the importance of food resources inpreventing mass extinction.
B. To illustrate a comparison between organisms thatlive on the land and those that live in the ocean.
C. To point out that certain species could never become extinct.
D. To demonstrate the interdependence of different species.
Câu 7: According to paragraph (A), evidence from fossils suggests that
A. extinctions on Earth have generally been massive.
B. there has been only one mass extinction in Earth's history.
C. extinction of species has occurred from time to time throughout Earth's history.
D. dinosaurs became extinct much earlier than scientists originally believed.
Câu 8: The word "finding" in paragraph (C) is closest in meaning to
A. research method
B. ongoing experiment
C. published information
D. scientific discovery
Câu 9: In paragraph (C), the author makes which of the following statements about a species' survival?
A. It may depend on chance events.
B. It does not vary greatly from species to species.
C. It reflects the interrelationship of many species.
D. It is associa

options.A: They have caused rapid change in the environment.
options.B: They have remained basically unchanged from their original forms.
options.C: They have been able to adapt to ecological changes.
options.D: They are no longer in existence.

options.A: To emphasize the importance of food resources inpreventing mass extinction.
options.B: To illustrate a comparison between organisms thatlive on the land and those that live in the ocean.
options.C: To point out that certain species could never become extinct.
options.D: To demonstrate the interdependence of different species.

options.A: extinctions on Earth have generally been massive.
options.B: there has been only one mass extinction in Earth's history.
options.C: extinction of species has occurred from time to time throughout Earth's history.
options.D: dinosaurs became extinct much earlier than scientists originally believed.

options.A: It may depend on chance events.
options.B: It does not vary greatly from species to species.
options.C: It reflects the interrelationship of many species.
options.D: It is associated with astronomical conditions.
